items.sentence: Tom is acting as though nothing has happened.
Tom is busy running an errand for his father.
I\'m not sure that I want to get to know Tom.
What\'s your favorite place to eat in Boston?
You\'ve got to tell Tom to go to bed earlier.
How often do you go camping with your family?
You can\'t keep Tom from going to work today.
Tom entered the dining room, carrying a tray.
Tom entered the house through the front door.
We aren\'t the only ones who have to do this.
I don\'t feel like having Chinese food today.
I thought you might know how to speak French.
You\'d better not let Tom see you doing that.
I have to do something before it\'s too late.
I didn\'t care for the third act of the play.
It was Tom who wanted to have the party here.
Tom wanted to go over a few things with Mary.
Tom wanted to go to the same college as Mary.
Tom heard the floorboards creaking above him.
You\'re the one who said you wanted to leave.
